revised_title: Observing the Beginning of a Lunar Eclipse in Madagascar
tldr: In 1681, Mr. Tho. Heathcot observed the beginning of a lunar eclipse on the island of St. Lawrence or Madagascar. Using a quadrant and a telescope, he determined the time of the eclipse's start and the geographical position of the island. The observation helped correct the position of Madagascar on maps, which was previously inaccurate by 7.5 degrees.
